title: I'm a time traveler. No one believes me. How can I convince them otherwise? - Quora

response.answer_text: In the infinite of existence ALL things are possible. If you tell me you are a time traveler I believe you. I am from an alternate reality myself, so I know the possibility of actual time “ travel “ is reasonable. In my case there was no “ travel “ as travel would indicate control and intent. For me it was something the military did to me that I do not really understand all I know is it was suppose to be a shared knowledge project. 4 pods, 5 people per pod. They selected subjects that had a highly specialized skill set for me it was electronics. I was rather amazing with electronics, scored off the charts, set the base record for all of my self paced classes which meant I finished A school very early which got me volunteered for this project. Anyway the theory was you take a group of people all with different special skills you put them into isolation tanks wire their brains together, shoot them full of drugs, then you bring their brain patterns into sync. We were then suppose to all have everyone’s skills. Crazy as it may seem it worked to a small degree we were tested and yes we knew things we did not know before, but that was not good enough they wanted us to all be experts, they got greedy more sessions more drugs more electrical stimulation. Well they got results but not what they were looking for. We shared more than knowledge, we shared souls and more tragic we shared each others sins. I guess that would have been ok if someone in one of the pods was not a rapist, someone else a serial killer. It was all there in our heads in all its detail like it was our own memory, that night 9 killed themselves, and we all experienced every death like we were the ones living it. As you can imagine they zapped us full of every sedative in the arsenal shoved us back into the pods and started trying to separate our brain patterns. When that did not work they started trying to wipe it all out with electroshock, actually killed 3 more of us trying to cure us. Long story short when I finally came back to a semblance of sanity 3 months had passed and I was on the 4th floor at Keesler in the mental ward. Only problem being I wasn’t me I was not in my reality or my body. When I tried to explain what had happened to the doctors at Keesler they zapped me so full of thorazine I spent the next month as a drool zombie living on jello. So the next time I talked to the doctors I played their game told them everything they wanted to hear and pretended to be someone I wasn’t. For almost 40 years now I’ve lived a reality that is not mine trying to remember who I am and what I knew. Trying to figure out what in my head is actually me and what is other people. As you can imagine its pretty crowded and chaotic in there most of the time. So when you tell me you are a time traveler who are “we” to say you aren’t. This was suppose to be an “ anything “ is possible scenario to prove a point. I did not expect Quora to ever publish this answer so now that they have, I feel the need to notate this is actually hyperbole designed to open minds and get people thinking about the possibility that everything is possible. That being said who knows, maybe this did happen to someone. The US military, federally funded universities, and DARPA do conduct a lot of morally and ethically questionable experiments on American servicemen.
